intro: Euphrasia coromandelina, commonly known as the Coromandel eyebright, is a flowering plant native to South and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Scrophulariaceae family and is characterized by its small, yellow-orange flowers with prominent yellow markings. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers bloom in clusters at the tips of the stems. Euphrasia coromandelina is often used in traditional medicine for its purported eye health benefits.
